meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'viny': covered in vines
meanings.sent1: The vinier garden had more vines than any other garden in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The vineyard looked even vinier after the recent rainfall.
meanings.sent3: The vinier tree seemed to be giving the house a vine hug.
meanings.sent4: The vinier landscape resembled a green blanket draped over the hills.
meanings.sent5: The vinier scenery was like stepping into a lush jungle.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'vain': excessively proud or concerned about one's appearance
meanings.sent1: She became vinier than ever when she won the beauty pageant.
meanings.sent2: His reflection in the mirror looked even vinier than usual.
meanings.sent3: The vinier girl spent hours admiring herself in the mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her vanity made her seem vinier than a peacock showing off its feathers.
meanings.sent5: Her vinier attitude made others feel uncomfortable around her.

meanings.definition: Comparative form of 'vain': producing no result; useless
meanings.sent1: The vinier attempt to fix the broken vase only made it worse.
meanings.sent2: His excuses for being late were getting vinier by the minute.
meanings.sent3: Trying to teach a cat to swim is as vinier as trying to teach a fish to climb a tree.
meanings.sent4: His efforts to impress her were as vinier as trying to catch the wind.
meanings.sent5: The vinier plan ended up causing more problems than it solved.
